decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Animate Dead. The deck includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also using control elements like Daze and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game through powerful creatures and strategic play.

The deck revolves around using Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Nomads en-Kor to create a combo that allows you to draw and play your entire deck in one turn. This is supported by cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to find key pieces, as well as mana acceleration from Gaea's Cradle and Llanowar Elves. The inclusion of Emrakul, the Aeons Torn provides a backup win condition in case the combo is disrupted. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces necessary to generate infinite mana with Gaea's Cradle and Nomads en-Kor, allowing for a win condition with abilities such as Nadu, Winged Wisdom or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck aims to ramp quickly with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Noble Hierarch, while utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to tutor for key pieces. Quirion Ranger and Birchlore Rangers help to untap lands for extra mana, while Allosaurus Shepherd protects against countermagic. The deck also includes utility cards like Endurance and Sylvan Safekeeper for protection and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to use Grindstone with Painter's Servant to mill the opponent's library. The deck also includes ways to tutor for combo pieces using Urza's Saga and Goblin Engineer, as well as disruption with Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. Additionally, the deck has mana acceleration through Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors, along with removal options like Lightning Bolt. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a win.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy and generate value. It includes cards like Crop Rotation, Wasteland, and Life from the Loam to continuously interact with the opponent's board and mana base. The deck also has a combo finish with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, it includes various utility lands like Maze of Ith and Bojuka Bog to handle specific situations. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until the deck's win conditions can take over.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively take control of the game by playing powerful creatures and disruptive spells quickly. The deck focuses on using cards like Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide, and Elvish Spirit Guide to accelerate its mana production, allowing it to play threats like Magus of the Moon and Minsc & Boo, Timeless Heroes ahead of schedule. The inclusion of cards like Fury and Broadside Bombardiers further emphasizes the deck's ability to quickly pressure opponents and disrupt their game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes Cavern of Souls to protect its creatures from countermagic and land disruption.

This Aggro-Maverick deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly by deploying efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Barrowgoyf early on, supported by mana acceleration from Ignoble Hierarch and Noble Hierarch. Gaddock Teeg helps shut down opposing combo decks, while removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay deal with threats efficiently. Green Sun's Zenith and Once Upon a Time provide consistency in finding key creatures, with support from cards like Palace Jailer and Renegade Rallier for added value. The deck also utilizes powerful lands like Gaea's Cradle and Karakas to gain additional advantage in the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library and win the game. The deck uses cards like Goblin Engineer to tutor for key pieces, along with disruption like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Chaos Defiler allows for alternate win conditions if needed. The strategy revolves around creating a lock with Painter's Servant and Grindstone, while using various cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plan.
